Admin / Sales Officer Job at Dainty Affairs Bakery




        
    

        
        Dainty Affairs Bakery is a renowned and respected culinary haven nestled in the heart of Lagos, Nigeria. We are celebrated for our world-class desserts, designs and incredible customer service. Our passion for excellence shines through in each creation, it’s what sets us apart and makes us a firm favorite among dessert lovers like you. Welcome to our baking store, where moments come alive through sweetness from artistic custom cakes to swift cake delivery service, our creations make occasions memorable.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin / Sales Officer

Job Location: Berger, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Key Responsibilities
We are looking for a proactive and highly motivated Admin/Sales Officer to join our team. In this candidates will do the following:


	Handle administrative tasks, record keeping, and documentation.
	Drive sales by reaching out to new and existing clients.
	Maintain customer relationships and provide excellent service.
	Prepare reports on sales activities and administrative operations.
	Support management with day-to-day office functions.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND / HND / B.Sc. Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field with 3 years of experience.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to multitask and work under minimal supervision.
	Previous experience in administration or sales is an added advantage.
	Proficiency in MS Office and basic IT tools.


Benefits


	Salary: N150,000 / Month
	Career growth opportunities.
	Supportive and professional work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: human.resource@daintyaffairs.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Over the course of almost 20 years of our existence, we have serviced various organizations, many of which are strong indigenous brands operating with global standards. We are most inclined to building strong brands and supporting business growth across industries. Our preference is to work with our clients as partners on an on-going basis towards making their organizations internally effective and more profitable. We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Civil Engineer&nbsp;(Road &amp; Building Construction)

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job Purpose


	To provide professional engineering expertise in the supervision and execution of road and building construction projects.
	The role ensures projects are delivered on time, within budget, and in compliance with engineering standards, safety regulations, and client specifications.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise and manage day-to-day site activities on road and building construction projects.
	Oversee project execution to ensure adherence to design, specifications, and engineering standards.
	Monitor contractors, subcontractors, and site workers to ensure compliance with project plans.
	Implement and monitor QA/QC systems across all stages of project execution.
	Inspect materials, workmanship, and processes to ensure compliance with standards and client requirements.
	Prepare and review method statements, ITPs (Inspection &amp; Test Plans), and QA/QC documentation.
	Prepare and review work schedules, progress reports, and technical documentation.
	Conduct quality control checks on construction materials, workmanship, and finished works.
	Ensure strict compliance with safety, health, and environmental (SHE) standards on site.
	Provide technical guidance and support to junior engineers, site supervisors, and foremen.
	Liaise with consultants, architects, surveyors, and clients for project updates and approvals.
	Manage resource allocation including manpower, equipment, and materials.
	Conduct site inspections to resolve technical issues and recommend corrective actions
	Enforce compliance with engineering codes, standards, and regulatory requirements.
	Support project planning, cost estimation, and contract administration processes.


Qualifications and Skills


	Education: B.Sc. / B.Eng. in Civil Engineering (M.Sc. is an added advantage).
	Minimum of 8 years hands-on experience in both road and building construction projects.
	Professional Certification: COREN, NSE, or equivalent recognized engineering body certification.
	Proven track record in site supervision, project execution, and compliance with engineering standards.
	Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and legal regulations.
	Proficiency in civil engineering software (AutoCAD, Civil 3D, MS Project, Primavera 6, etc.).
	Excellent leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

	Project Management and Execution.
	Site Supervision &amp; Quality Control.
	Technical and Regulatory Compliance.
	Strong Analytical and Reporting Skills.
	Team Leadership and Collaboration.
	Attention to Detail and Safety Consciousness.


Salary

Job Purpose

	The role ensures projects are delivered on time, within budget, and in compliance with engineering standards, safety regulations, and client specifications.

	Supervise and manage day-to-day site activities on road and building construction projects.
	Oversee project execution to ensure adherence to design, specifications, and engineering standards.
	Monitor contractors, subcontractors, and site workers to ensure compliance with project plans.
	Implement and monitor QA/QC systems across all stages of project execution.
	Inspect materials, workmanship, and processes to ensure compliance with standards and client requirements.
	Prepare and review method statements, ITPs (Inspection & Test Plans), and QA/QC documentation.
	Prepare and review work schedules, progress reports, and technical documentation.
	Conduct quality control checks on construction materials, workmanship, and finished works.
	Ensure strict compliance with safety, health, and environmental (SHE) standards on site.
	Provide technical guidance and support to junior engineers, site supervisors, and foremen.
	Liaise with consultants, architects, surveyors, and clients for project updates and approvals.
	Manage resource allocation including manpower, equipment, and materials.
	Conduct site inspections to resolve technical issues and recommend corrective actions
	Enforce compliance with engineering codes, standards, and regulatory requirements.
	Support project planning, cost estimation, and contract administration processes.


Qualifications and Skills


	Education: B.Sc. / B.Eng. in Civil Engineering (M.Sc. is an added advantage).
	Minimum of 8 years hands-on experience in both road and building construction projects.
	Professional Certification: COREN, NSE, or equivalent recognized engineering body certification.
	Proven track record in site supervision, project execution, and compliance with engineering standards.
	Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and legal regulations.
	Proficiency in civil engineering software (AutoCAD, Civil 3D, MS Project, Primavera 6, etc.).
	Excellent leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Key Competencies:


	Project Management and Execution.
	Site Supervision & Quality Control.
	Technical and Regulatory Compliance.
	Strong Analytical and Reporting Skills.
	Team Leadership and Collaboration.
	Attention to Detail and Safety Consciousness.

N500,000 and above based on experience

Sales Executive Job at Ascentech Services Limited




        
    

        
        Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Executive

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Sales & Business Development

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a highly motivated and results-driven Sales Executive from the FMCG sector to join our team.
	In this role, you will be responsible for expanding our market presence, driving sales, and building strong relationships with clients and channel partners within your assigned territory.
	You will play a key role in achieving revenue growth and enhancing brand visibility through effective sales strategies and customer engagement.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify, develop, and manage new business opportunities in the assigned territory.
	Establish and maintain strong relationships with clients, distributors, and other key stakeholders.
	Execute sales strategies to achieve growth targets and increase market share.
	Conduct market analysis to identify trends, competitor activities, and customer needs.
	Prepare and deliver persuasive sales presentations and product demonstrations.
	Visit customers and prospects regularly to promote products/services and close deals.
	Collaborate with the marketing and product teams to align strategies and campaigns.
	Maintain accurate records of customer interactions, sales activities, and performance.
	Provide feedback from the field to help improve products, services, and customer satisfaction.
	Participate in trade shows, promotional events, and networking opportunities.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field.
	3–5 years of experience in sales, business development, or territory management (preferably FMCG).
	Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.
	Self-motivated with excellent organizational and time-management skills.
	Willingness to travel extensively within the assigned territory.
	Proficiency in MS Office and CRM tools.


Salary Range
N164,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested candidates should send their CV to: cv@ascentech.com.ng using “Sales Executive (Port Harcourt)” as the subject of the email.
